jsymbolic2.api

Class jSymbolicProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • jsymbolic2.api.jSymbolicProcessor

  • public class jSymbolicProcessor
extends java.lang.Object
    This class acts as an API for jSymbolic. The constructor allows the programmer to input the particular options they would like to extract from jSymbolic. The appropriate functions can then be called to obtain the jSymbolic Data from a particular music file or directory.

    • Constructor Detail

      • jSymbolicProcessor

        public jSymbolicProcessor(double window_size,
                          double window_overlap,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> feature_names,
                          boolean save_features_for_each_window,
                          boolean save_overall_recording_features,
                          boolean convert_to_arff,
                          boolean convert_to_csv,
                          java.lang.String feature_values_save_path,
                          java.lang.String feature_definitions_save_path)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Constructor to build jSymbolicProcessor object from raw input data.
        Parameters:
        window_size - Raw window size for MIDI window.
        window_overlap - Raw window overlap for MIDI window overlap offset.
        feature_names - Raw list of feature names which will we checked for validity.
        save_features_for_each_window - Whether or not to save features for each window. If this is true then the overall recording must be false.
        save_overall_recording_features - Whether or not to save features for overall recording If this is true then the windowed recording must be false.
        feature_values_save_path - Save path for the feature values to be saved to ACE XML. Although a valid save path must be specified, this is not important to the API.
        feature_definitions_save_path - Save path for the feature definitions to be saved to ACE XML. Although a valid save path must be specified, this is not important to the API.
        convert_to_arff - Whether or not to convert feature values file to arff format.
        convert_to_csv - Whether or not to convert feature values file to csv arff format.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown when a particular feature name in the feature_names list does not exist in jSymbolic.

      • jSymbolicProcessor

        public jSymbolicProcessor(double window_size,
                          double window_overlap,
                          boolean save_features_for_each_window,
                          boolean save_overall_recording_features,
                          boolean convert_to_arff,
                          boolean convert_to_csv,
                          java.lang.String feature_values_save_path,
                          java.lang.String feature_definitions_save_path)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Constructor to build jSymbolicProcessor object from raw input data using the default feature names. Therefore no feature names need to be explicitly given to the constructor.
        Parameters:
        window_size - Raw window size for MIDI window.
        window_overlap - Raw window overlap for MIDI window overlap offset.
        save_features_for_each_window - Whether or not to save features for each window. If this is true then the overall recording must be false.
        save_overall_recording_features - Whether or not to save features for overall recording If this is true then the windowed recording must be false.
        feature_values_save_path - Save path for the feature values to be saved to ACE XML. Although a valid save path must be specified, this is not important to the API.
        feature_definitions_save_path - Save path for the feature definitions to be saved to ACE XML. Although a valid save path must be specified, this is not important to the API.
        convert_to_arff - Whether or not to convert feature values file to arff format.
        convert_to_csv - Whether or not to convert feature values file to csv arff format.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown when a particular feature name in the feature_names list does not exist in jSymbolic.

      • jSymbolicProcessor

        public jSymbolicProcessor(java.lang.String configurationFile)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Constructor to build the jSymbolicProcessor using the specified configuration file settings. An invalid configuration file will result in an error output to the console and termination of the program. Notice that this will not process the input files as these should be obtained when making the API function calls.
        Parameters:
        configurationFile - The specified configuration file that the jSymbolic settings will be taken from.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown when the configuration file is not valid.

    • Method Detail

      • computeJsymbolicData

        public jSymbolicData computeJsymbolicData(java.io.File input_file,
                                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> errorLog)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Obtain a jSymbolic data object given a single input music file.
        Parameters:
        input_file - The music file to extract data from.
        errorLog - The error log to see if any files are invalid. This will be printed out to console after processing and any invalid files will be outputted.
        Returns:
        A jSymbolicData object that contains all the necessary data from jSymbolic.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the input music file is not valid.

      • computeJsymbolicDataDirectory

        public java.util.Map<java.io.File,jSymbolicData> computeJsymbolicDataDirectory(java.io.File directory,
                                                                               java.util.List<java.lang.String> errorLog)
                                                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Obtain a jSymbolic data object given a directory of music files. This will also check subdirectories all with valid file extension. Currently, the valid file extensions are .mei and .midi.
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory to obtain the files from.
        errorLog - The error log to see if any files are invalid. This will be printed out to console after processing and any invalid files will be outputted.
        Returns:
        A Map with a File as a key and jSymbolicData as a value. They specific File keys can be obtained using the keySet() function of the Map object. This is recommended as then the appropriate jSymbolicData value can be obtained to get the corresponding desired data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the directory is not valid.
